description: From Late Latin legibilis (“that can be read”), from Latin legō.

adjectives.description: legible (comparative more legible, superlative most legible)

entries.meaning: Clear enough to be read; readable, particularly of handwriting.
examples: Synonyms: clean, clear, decipherable, fair, readable
Despite hardly having any energy to lift a pen, she left a legible note on the paper.

entries.meaning: Written or phrased so as to be easy to understand.
examples: You can make this program code more legible by using meaningful variable names.
